001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005
006/**
007 * Represents a loss function that operates at the per-dimension level.
008 * <p>
009 * Each output dimension of a sample can have its own loss, which is then
010 * aggregated into a per-sample loss (L) or batch loss (J) by higher-level
011 * loss functions such as {@link BatchLossFunction}.
012 * </p>
013 *
014 * <p>Definitions:</p>
015 * <ul>
016 *   <li><b>Dimension loss (l):</b> the loss computed for a single output dimension.</li>
017 *   <li><b>Gradient dl/da:</b> the derivative of the dimension loss with respect to the activation (output) of this dimension,
018 *       used in backpropagation.</li>
019 * </ul>
020 */
021@DomainObject
022@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
023public interface DimensionLossFunction extends LossFunction {
024
025    /**
026     * Calculates the loss for a single dimension, given the estimated value
027     * and the target value.
028     *
029     * @param estimated the predicted or estimated value
030     * @param target    the expected or target value
031     * @return the loss for this dimension as a {@code float}
032     */
033    float calculateDimensionLoss(float estimated, float target);
034
035    /**
036     * Calculates the gradient of the dimension loss with respect to the
037     * activation (output) of this dimension. This corresponds to dl/da
038     * in backpropagation formulas.
039     *
040     * @param estimated the predicted or estimated value for this dimension
041     * @param target    the expected or target value for this dimension
042     * @return the gradient of the loss with respect to the activation
043     */
044    float calculateGradient_dl_da(float estimated, float target);
045
046}
